question.text: What is the collective term for "habitat loss and fragmentation, over-exploitation, invasion of alien species and co-extinction"?

options.text: Four major causes of increasing biodiversity

solution.text: The accelerated rates of species extinctions that the world is facing now are largely due to human activities. There are four major causes ('The Evil Quartet' is the sobriquet used to describe them). In general, loss of biodiversity in a region may lead to  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  decline in plant production,  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  lowered resistance to environmental perturbations such as drought and  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  increased variability in certain ecosystem processes such as plant productivity, water use, and pest and disease cycles.
